chain.name: Chain
chain.description: Connects components together. Click on sprockets to create a chain path. Chains carry the 'current' (rotational motion) between parts.

junction.name: Junction
junction.description: A connection point where multiple chains can meet. Current flowing into a junction splits among outgoing chains, just like a wire junction in electronics.

motor.name: Battery
motor.description: The power source for your circuit. Wind it up to store energy, then release to drive current through your circuit. Click to wind or release.

resistor.name: Resistor
resistor.description: Slows down spinning motion using friction. Higher resistance values create more friction, reducing current flow. Click to change resistance value.

capacitor.name: Capacitor
capacitor.description: Stores rotational energy in a spring mechanism. Charges up when current flows in, then releases that energy when the circuit allows. Click to change capacitance.

inductor.name: Inductor
inductor.description: Uses spinning weights to resist changes in current flow. The heavier the weights, the more it resists sudden changes. Stores energy as rotational momentum.

phonograph.name: Audio Meter
phonograph.description: Produces sound based on current flow. The pitch and volume change with chain speed. Use it to hear your circuit's behavior.

ammeter.name: Gauge Ammeter
ammeter.description: Displays current as a visual gauge with needle indicator. Click to change scale range. Shows both magnitude and direction of current flow.

diode.name: Diode
diode.description: Allows current to flow in only one direction. When current tries to flow backwards, the diode blocks it like a one-way valve.

button.name: Switch
button.description: A manual on/off switch. Click to toggle the connection between open (no current) and closed (current flows). Use to control your circuit.

transistor.name: Transistor
transistor.description: An electronic switch controlled by current. A small current at the gate (base) controls whether a larger current can flow through the main path.

level-changer.name: Level Changer
level-changer.description: Connects chains at different height levels. Use this to route chains over or under each other, enabling more complex 3D circuit layouts.

tile.name: Tile
tile.description: Base plate for mounting components. Provides a stable foundation but has no electrical function. Use to organize your circuit layout.

interact.name: Interact
interact.description: Click components to interact with them. Wind up batteries, press switches, and watch your circuit in action.

move.name: Move
move.description: Drag components to reposition them on the workspace. Chains will stretch or break when you move connected parts.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Click on components or chains to remove them from the circuit. Deleted parts are gone permanently.

edit.name: Edit
edit.description: Click components to change their values. Adjust resistance, capacitance, or other properties.
